content.title: ICAR Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: A post-matric scholarship scheme by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) for the Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes candidates for study at Bachelor Degree program in various branches of Agriculture, viz. B.Sc.(Agri.), B.V.Sc., B.Sc.(Agril. Engg.), B.Sc.(Home Science), B.F.Sc., B.Sc.(Forestry) etc. The value of the scholarship will be ₹ 300/- per month along with a contingent grant of ₹ 750/- per annum for the payment of tuition fees, purchase of books, cost of uniforms, etc. The duration of the scholarship will cover the whole of the normal period of the particular degree program to which the candidate is admitted. The scheme provides for the award of 240 scholarships every year.
benefits: Value of the Scholarship: ₹ 300/- per month along with a contingent grant of ₹ 750/- per annum for the payment of tuition fees, purchase of books, cost of uniforms, etc.
Duration of the Scholarship: Covers the whole of the normal period of the particular degree program.
Number of Scholarships: 240 scholarships awarded every year.
eligibility: The applicant must be a citizen of India.
The applicant must belong to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes communities as defined by the Government of India.
The applicant must have been admitted to Agricultural Universities in any of the undergraduate degree programs of Agriculture & Allied Sciences.
exclusions: The student who accepts this scholarship will not be permitted to avail of any other scholarship/concession provided by any other agencies nor permitted to accept any part-time employment.

Termination of Scholarship: The scholarship will be terminated without notice if the scholar debases to be on the roll of the institution or if the scholar is found to be negligent in studies or guilty of misconduct.
documents_required: Proof of being admitted to an Agricultural University in an undergraduate degree program of Agriculture & Allied Sciences

faqs.question: What is the Procedure of Selection for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides for the award of 240 scholarships every year, earmarked for individual Agricultural Universities in proportion to the actual number of scheduled castes / scheduled tribes candidates admitted.

faqs.question: Will Scholarship During The Leave On Medical Grounds Be Admissible?
faqs.answer: Yes, full scholarship will be paid if the absence does not exceed two months due to illness supported by medical certificate.

faqs.question: Can I Accept Any Part-Time Employment during the term of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, the student who accepts this scholarship will not be permitted to avail of any other scholarship/concession or accept any part-time employment.

faqs.question: What shall happen if the scholar is dropped by the institution due to peer performance?
faqs.answer: If the scholar is dropped by the institution due to peer performance, his/her scholarship will be terminated.
